features: Experience magnificent full-HD 1080P. This USB Webcam comes with enhanced capability utilizing the CMOS ⅓ image sensor. Wide 70° viewing angle, no optical distortion. Great for webinars, and video conferencing.
The Amcrest 1080p HD Webcam comes with a Privacy Cover, the privacy covers your webcam when not in use, and prevents web hackers from spying on you. Provides security, privacy and ease of mind.

Webcam with Built-in Microphone. Built-in dual noise reducing microphone, superior stereo audio, which allows for clear and natural sound recording. It’s the best choice of video combined with a built-in microphone to provide the best video conference experience even in a noisy environment.

USB 2.0 Plug & Play. Fits for multi-operations: Windows, Mac OS and Android etc. Platform Compatibility: Skype, Youtube, Yahoo!@Messenger, MSN, Zoom, Windows Live@Messager, Gmail, WeChat etc instant messaging applications.

Versatile Placement - The Amcrest Webcam comes with a mounting clip and ¼ tripod thread, so that you can use it on just about any surface. At Amcrest, we want to ensure the safety of our customers, their loved ones, homes, and businesses.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality Webcam, Prices Right During COVID
reviews.reviewText: In reviewing the Amcrest 1080P Webcam (Model AWC201-B), I was very impressed. This camera came in at less than $50, and during COVID times to boot. Setup came with ease. All I had to do was plug this webcam into my Windows 10 computer. It was picked right up in device manager as an attached device, and I had no issues with detection.Upon first glance, I did like that it looked / felt professional. It didn’t seem cheap. I also own a Logitech C920 1080P webcam, so I picked up both units, one in each hand, and observed similarities and differences. First, the Logitech did seem to have a smoother look to the plastics. A more polished look you could say. However, the Amcrest webcam didn’t feel weak or cheap, it seemed to have a durable feel to it as well, just a more matte, textured finish to the plastic housing. Both had a mounting system underneath for a monitor, and the Amcrest seemed to hug the top of my monitor nicely.Both cameras had privacy covers, however I did like that the Logitech cover was removable. Not that I would probably ever take the cover off, but the Amcrest cover was stuck on permanently and I felt as though I had one shot to get it right. Not to mention, I felt I should treat it extra delicate after placing the cover on, as not to accidentally dislodge it.After plugging the camera in, I went straight to Microsoft Teams. I have been using Microsoft Teams for work for quite some time now. The Amcrest webcam was immediately detected and set itself as my default webcam / microphone. I performed a test call and noticed that the picture quality was great. In fact, I believe the picture quality to be better than the Logitech webcam. It seemed to have better color and lighting aspects. The Logitch appeared more washed out and over exposed, while the Amcrest did a good job of capturing the true color in the room, as well as balancing out the lighting. The mic quality was great too. Those who joined Teams calls with me did not notice any differences between the Logitech and Amcrest camera mic quality.The final feature I noticed was that the Amcrest webcam had an extra wide-angle lens. I found this nice as it gave me room to move around the screen without getting clipped off. A side by side comparison between the Amcrest and Logitech camera showed that the Amcrest field of view was undeniably wider.I used the Amcrest webcam for two weeks straight with no issues. I attended nearly 100 Microsoft Teams meetings during that time and had no issues with the camera. In addition to my use, my wife used the camera steadily for her school Zoom meetings. She too noticed the great quality / sound from the webcam and had no issues.Overall, I feel that the Amcrest camera is a great quality webcam for the price. Although the plastics didn’t feel quite as polished as its Logitech competitor, the camera performed flawlessly, and I found no real issues in my testing. I also found it a bonus to find such a high quality 1080P camera available for under $50 during COVID times. It was delivered to me via Amazon Prime in just two days.I would have no issues purchasing additional Amcrest webcams both for my home and work environment. Before being given the opportunity to review, I was not aware of Amcrest webcams, so I feel privileged to now be able to consider it as an option.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A great option for the average or below average video user
reviews.reviewText: In the absence/reduction of face-to-face time during this health crisis period, people have become extremely reliant on proxy contact to keep in touch with one another. Having relied on their home security system for years, I was thrilled to learn that Amcrest also had a line of webcams, to connect to the outside world. I’ve relied on my Microsoft LifeCam HD-3000 since 2011 so I saw it fit to upgrade to and test out the modern and affordable Amcrest 1080P HD Webcam (AWC201-B).My old system’s video quality maxed out at 720p (this was HD back in 2011) so I was eager to upgrade to a 1080p system for webchats. Out of the small box, the camera comes in a pretty simple two-piece set-up; a detached plastic material lens-cover and the webcam itself with an embedded 5’9” USB2.0 power/connection cord. I would have preferred to have the lens cover preinstalled or integrated onto the camera instead of it being a separate piece. The lens cover attaches to the camera using a double-sided tape that is preinstalled on the cover itself. The face of the camera is a glass type construction split into three sections. The camera section is in the center with two LED lights mounted to each side of the lens. The microphone receiver is to the left of the lens and the right side just has the manufacture logo printed on it. The backing of the camera feels like a pretty common plastic covering. The stand/clip mount appears to be of the same plastic quality as the camera backing; there is an option to mount the camera on a tripod via a female 1/4” connector on the bottom plate of the stand. The folding clip feels sturdy and the contact points are cushioned with rubber padding to prevent scratching or scuffing. Overall, it’s not a bad looking webcam and it’s all black color scheme will allow it to be integrated easily into any setup.Installation and setup of this camera is pretty straight forward on my Windows 10 system; it’s pretty much plug-and-play. There is no on/off switch on the camera but the two LED indicator lights on the camera will light up when the camera and mic are accessed. The long cable allows for a variety of mounting positions. The camera itself does not have any software to manage it; instead, it is managed via whichever third-party app is used to operate it. Mounting the camera on the top of my computer monitor, it is only adjustable vertically. Horizontal adjustment is only possible by physically moving the entire camera to a different part of the monitor, standing it on the desk, or mounting it on a tripod. The video field of view is 70 degrees so it captures a decent amount of the environment; make sure nothing is in frame - that you don’t want seen.Not surprisingly, this camera’s video quality is an improvement over my old 720p device; but, it’s really nothing to marvel over in today’s world of standard 4K video quality. I tested the camera using the default Windows 10 camera app and OBS Studio. The Windows 10 app does not offer much of anything to adjust the camera settings with. Windows 10’s default microphone setting does not allow for any audio setting changes beyond volume adjustment. OBS offers more but it’s not something most users will know how to tinker with. I originally wanted to be able to use this camera for streaming or content creation but found that it is only really good for the occasional camera user. The video quality is not sharp enough or clear to be able to compete with today’s 4K technology that can be had on most smartphones. The audio quality sounds muffled, does not filter out background sounds, and captures a lot of static wind/air noise. I found that a separate and dedicated microphone and video setup would better suit my needs. However, for webchats and meetings while at my workstation, this product is cheap and decent enough to accomplish those needs.Bottom-line, this is a simple product to use that requires no prior knowledge or experience. It’s fairly affordable, decently constructed, and isn’t too bad of a looker for most average desktop setups/users. Price to performance, I would say that this is a definite 4 out of 5 stars due to a lack of supportive software.
The quality is pretty good for the price it wouldn’t work at first but after a minute or two it worked, I couldn’t seem to figure out the mic but that’s not to impotent to me.
